messages.messageBody:
I love the idea...but I live in Central FL...how could I participate?
Twana

----- Original Message -----
From: Ann <mumsienc@...>
To: Unschooling <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, August 28, 2001 6:18 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Book sharing


> Well, now that we have the recipe sharing list going, would anyone be
> interested in having a book sharing list going too?
> Nothing fancy, but when you've read a good book yourself, or read one to
> your kids, or your kids have read a good one you could type in the name
> and author and send.
> What does everyone think?
> Or would people rather just do it on the unschooling list?
> Ann

messages.messageBody:
Ann,

I think book sharing is a great idea. Is there a database on the website that could be set up to share books for those that want too. While others who would before not to don't have to bother. Bonnie who loves books and always wants to hear about a good one!


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Book sharing
messages.msgSnippet: Dear Ann, If you are looking for some good book suggestions for yourself and your kids click on the link below:
messages.messageBody:
Dear Ann,

If you are looking for some good book suggestions for
yourself and your kids click on the link below:

http://freepages.education.rootsweb.com/~maia/reading.htm

On the page is several differrent links to different
book lists.

Samantha

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Book sharing
messages.msgSnippet: ... interested in having a book sharing list going too? ... Dear Ann Another list, please.  Some of us older Mamma s would never get through listing books! We
messages.messageBody:
--- Ann <mumsienc@...> wrote:
interested in having a book sharing list going too?
> What does everyone think?
> Or would people rather just do it on the unschooling
> list?
> Ann

Dear Ann
Another list, please. Some of us older Mamma's would
never get through listing books! We are talking
thousands. It is a good idea, but I prefer to opt
out. If a particularly special book comes along
related to a topic (or not) or if someone is compelled
to share an enlightening book experience, that is
different!
Thanks, Sharon

messages.subject: Book sharing
messages.msgSnippet: Well, now that we have the recipe sharing list going, would anyone be interested in having a book sharing list going too? Nothing fancy, but when you ve read a
messages.messageBody:
Well, now that we have the recipe sharing list going, would anyone be
interested in having a book sharing list going too?
Nothing fancy, but when you've read a good book yourself, or read one to
your kids, or your kids have read a good one you could type in the name
and author and send.
What does everyone think?
Or would people rather just do it on the unschooling list?
Ann
